name: Anglera
headline: AI Copilot for Merchandising
description:
At Anglera, we're developing a suite of AI agents to help e-commerce companies run their operations more efficiently. Our flagship agent helps our customers onboard, enrich, and manage their product data, reducing time per product from 15 mins down to 5 seconds.

We previously developed ML to automatically enrich millions of products at Uber Eats, and we're now on a mission to automate the most common manual workflows for every e-commerce business.
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:machine-learning; industry:saas; industry:b2b; industry:e-commerce; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Amay Aggarwal, Founder
founders.description:
Amay is the Co-Founder of Anglera. 
He graduated from Stanford with Bachelor's & Master's degrees, specializing in AI/ML.
Previously, he led Catalog AI efforts to onboard, enrich, & standardize millions of products sold on Uber Eats.

founders.name: Ray Iyer, Founder
founders.description: Ray is the Co-Founder of Anglera. He graduated from Stanford with a BS and MS in Computer Science, specializing in Systems & AI. Previously, he launched the first CPG Ads products at Uber Eats, and worked in engineering roles at Meta, Verkada, & Microsoft.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Anglera**

Anglera is an exciting startup founded in 2024, based in San Francisco, and part of Y Combinator's Batch S24. With a razor-sharp focus on e-commerce, Anglera is on a mission to revolutionize merchandising through the power of AI. Imagine reducing the average time it takes to onboard and manage product data from 15 minutes to just 5 seconds—sounds almost magical, doesn’t it? That’s what Anglera is all about.

**Mission Statement**

At its core, Anglera’s mission is to be the AI copilot for merchandising. Their goal? To automate and streamline the most common manual workflows in e-commerce, allowing businesses to operate more efficiently and effectively.

**Innovative Solutions**

Anglera has developed a suite of AI agents designed to tackle the complexities of e-commerce operations. Their flagship product enables seamless onboarding, enriching, and managing of product catalogs. Just a few features that make Anglera stand out include:

- **Supplier Onboarding:** Simplifying the transformation of messy product data into structured attributes.
- **Detailed Metadata Management:** Ensuring that product information is always complete, accurate, and up to date.
- **Pricing Intelligence:** Analyzing competitors’ pricing in real time to help e-commerce businesses stay competitive.
- **Trend Analysis and Image Processing:** Allowing businesses to maintain quality and relevancy in their product offerings.
- **Listing Optimization:** Helping products rank better and convert more efficiently.

In just a short time, Anglera has curated over 500,000 products and saved their customers an impressive 25,000+ hours. The testimonials from happy clients echo the impact of Anglera’s solutions—transforming tedious processes into near-instantaneous actions.

**Team and Backing**

With a lean team of two and Aaron Epstein as their Group Partner, Anglera may be small but packs a punch. The company is backed by Y Combinator, which lends significant credence to its potential in the competitive e-commerce landscape.

**Conclusion**

Anglera is not just another tech startup; it's a game-changer for e-commerce. By leveraging AI to automate complex tasks, they're helping businesses save time and money while enhancing the overall shopping experience. For e-commerce companies looking to streamline their operations, Anglera is definitely worth watching. Want to see the magic for yourself? You can [book a demo](https://www.anglera.com/<https:/calendly.com/amay-anglera/15-min>) and experience their AI-powered solutions firsthand at [Anglera's website](https://www.anglera.com/).
